# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    current_line = ""
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            wrapped_text *= current_line * "\n"
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line != ""
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    wrapped_text *= current_line

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

The `wrap_string` function takes a string `text` and an optional `text_width` parameter which defaults to 10. It splits the input string into words and iterates over them. If adding the next word would exceed the `text_width`, it starts a new line and adds the current word to that line. Finally, it returns the wrapped text.
